comment.author: 41668727@N05
comment._content: It is called Maydon Wharf, named after John George Maydon, a prominent local statesman and instigator in the development of Durban Harbour. Maydon Wharf was built alongside a swamp that was known as the Congella Flats, reclaimed for the purpose of stacking cargo and providing warehouse accommodation. Credit to Facts about Durban. www.fad.co.za
